decision_conditions: In scaling off the submitted drawings, the proposals exceed the 50 cubic metres content of the original roof space parameter for a semi detached dwelling. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to Condition B.2 (d) the cubic content of the resulting roofspace would exceed the cubic content of the original roof space by more than  - (i) 40 cubic metres in case of a terrace house or (ii) 50 cubic metres in any other cases) of Class B, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order (as amended)

Insufficient  and imprecise information has been submitted to demonstrate that, on balance of probability, the proposed external insulation would not materially affect the external appearance  of the dwellinghouse. It has therefore not been demonstrated that the proposed works would comprise works as described under Section 55 (2) (a) (ii) of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990) (as amended) and as such the proposed external insulation is considered to comprise development which would require planning permission.

Due to the submission of inconsistent and contradictory plans  together with the  scope of the description of development,  Officers are unable to fully assess the impact of the proposed development on the character appearance of the host dwelling or the immediate surrounding area.
description: Erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions with installation of 3nos. front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion, external wall insulation and window alterations.
